creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Red lantern: {Bunka 4} (1807); White sign board: {oyasumi dokoro} (rest area), {sen cha} (green tea); Green banner: {Ōsaka kudari onna} (Women from Ōsaka)
markings: Fan print of man in black kimono bears the signature of {Toyokuni}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: This artist was a student of Shun'ei and is written Shunkō 春紅. He is different to the famous Katsukawa Shunkō written 春好.
title: (Fireworks at a Summer Festival)
